adjective.description: Sending out light; shining or glowing brightly.
examples: a bird with radiant green and red plumage

adjective.description: (of heat) transmitted by radiation, rather than conduction or convection.

noun.description: A point or object from which light or heat radiates, especially a heating element in an electric or gas heater.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin radiant- emitting rays, from the verb radiare (see radiate).
